meanings.definition: Capable of laughing; inclined to laugh.
meanings.sent1: The children found the clown's performance quite risible.
meanings.sent2: Her jokes were so funny that they were risible to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The risible puppy chased its tail in circles, making everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: The risible nature of the situation made it impossible to keep a straight face.
meanings.sent5: The risible movie scene had the audience roaring with laughter.

meanings.sent1: The comedian's risible antics had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent2: The silly dance was so risible that even the grumpiest person chuckled.
meanings.sent3: Watching the cat try to catch a laser pointer was a truly risible sight.
meanings.sent4: The risible situation reminded me of a hilarious scene from a comedy show.
meanings.sent5: The risible cartoon characters made the kids burst into laughter.

meanings.sent1: His risible attempt at singing made his friends tease him playfully.
